#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=South
#Text=Korean police clamp down on protests against US beef
#Text=Monday , June 30 , 2008

#Text=South Korean authorities are refusing to allow more protests against the government 's decision to allow beef imports from the United States , after hundreds of people were injured in clashes with riot police overnight Saturday .
#Text=Around 300 police buses blocked protesters from entering the plaza in front of Seoul City Hall on Sunday , where a candlelight vigil was scheduled for that night .
#Text=Any rally held after sunset without police permission is considered illegal .
#Text=Nevertheless , the daily vigils have continued for weeks , with as many as 80,000 in attendance .

#Text=After the plaza was sealed off , a group of about 1,700 protesters gathered in nearby streets , chanting slogans that urged President Lee Myung-Bak to cancel his decision allowing U.S. beef imports .
#Text=Around 70 people were detained by police for illegally occupying roads , South Korean news agency Yonhap reported , but no major clashes occurred .
#Text=Over 200 protesters and police officers were injured in Saturday 's protests .
#Text=The demonstration turned violent when some protesters tried to drag away police buses used to prevent entry into Cheongwadae , the President 's house .
#Text=Riot police responded by spraying water cannons and fire extinguishers at the protesters , who threw stones , water bottles and eggs at police .
#Text=The candle-lit vigils , which were initially peaceful , have mutated into violent protests organized by a small faction .
#Text=— Kim Kyung Han , Minister of Justice
#Text=Government officials said they would not tolerate violent , illegal demonstrations .
#Text=" The candle-lit vigils , which were initially peaceful , have mutated into violent protests organized by a small faction , " said Justice Minister Kim Kyung Han .
#Text=He vowed to " chase those who instigate violent protests " and " bring them to justice " .
#Text=Kim warned that the government might begin using water laced with tear gas against protesters , even though tear gas has been banned since 1999 .

#Text=In April , President Lee Myung-Bak agreed to resume the importing of U.S. beef , which was banned in 2003 after the United States discovered its first case of bovine spongiform encephalopathy , or mad cow disease .
#Text=Lee has faced a major backlash from this decision , amid fears of the possible spread of this sometimes fatal disease .
#Text=He was forced to publicly apologize , and all but one of his top advisers were fired .
#Text=Jang Dae-hyun , a spokesman for the protesters , suggested that the police should stop using harsh tactics against protesters , which he says would lead to less violence .
#Text=" We 've been supporting peaceful rallies , but the police crackdown is too harsh , " Jang said .
#Text=One protester , Kim In-seok , stated , " We are just here to express our opinions .
